Detailed Description

Simple class used to represent a reduced constraint matrix by pointing to the full one in order to avoid having to allocate and copy the reduced matrix when taking the SVD.

Represents the H matrix which is the reduced form of diag(y)*B.

Implements the Mutli-phase Gibbs function continuation method.

Computes the partial derivatives of the equilibrium species moles with respect to some change in the species Gibbs energies.

For instance, to compute dN/dT, supply the dg/dT vector.

Definition at line 201 of file MultiPhaseEquilSolver.h.

◆ equilibrate()

std::pair< int, int > equilibrate ( double  T,
double  P,
const double *const  p_ev,
double *const  p_sv,
MoleFracDef  mfd = GLOBAL 
)

Computes the equilibrium composition of the mixture.

The returned species mole-fraction array is computed based on the value of the MoleFracDef parameter. The default method defines the mole fractions globally, though they can also be defined in-phase.

Returns
A pair representing the number of iterations and Newton iterations used to compute the solution. If the solution procedure fails because the feasible region is empty or unbounded, then the iterations are negative.
